Class Manager

java.lang.Object
users.Employee
users.Manager
public class Manager extends Employee
The Manager class represents a Manager user in the Firm Management System. This class extends the Employee superclass and provides additional functionality specific to the Manager role. Managers can perform various operations such as viewing and managing employees, hiring and firing, and accessing algorithms

  • Constructor Details

    • Manager

      public Manager(int ID, String Username, String Role, String Name, String Surname, String Phone, LocalDate DOB, LocalDate DOS, String Email, String Password, Boolean DEFAULT_PASSWORD)
      Constructs a Manager object with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      ID - Unique identifier for the manager.
      Username - The manager's username.
      Role - The role of the user (Manager).
      Name - The manager's first name.
      Surname - The manager's last name.
      Phone - The manager's phone number.
      DOB - Date of birth of the manager.
      DOS - Date of starting in the organization.
      Email - The manager's email address.
      Password - The manager's password.
      DEFAULT_PASSWORD - Whether the password is default or customized.

  • Method Details

    • Menu

      public void Menu()
      Displays the Manager's menu and processes user input. The menu allows the manager to perform actions such as viewing and updating profiles, managing employees, and executing algorithms. The menu runs in a loop until the manager chooses to log out.
      Specified by:
      Menu in class Employee

    • HireEmployeeManager

      protected void HireEmployeeManager()
      Allows the manager to hire a new employee. The method collects necessary details about the new employee such as username, name, surname, role, date of birth, and date of starting. The details are validated before being added to the database.

    • FireEmployeeManager

      protected void FireEmployeeManager()
      Allows the manager to fire an existing employee. The method verifies if the employee exists and prevents the manager from firing themselves also checks if the firing operation is final. If validation succeeds, the employee is removed from the database.

    • UpdateEmployee

      protected void UpdateEmployee()
      Updates information for an existing employee. The method prompts the manager to modify specific fields of the employee profile except for personal details.
